com.characterforming.jrte

Interface IParameterizedEffector<T extends ITarget,P>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The effector target type
    P - The effector parameter type, constructible from byte[][] (eg new P(byte[][]))
    All Superinterfaces:
    IEffector<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseParameterizedEffector

    public interface IParameterizedEffector<T extends ITarget,P>
extends IEffector<T>
    Interface for parameterised effectors. Parameters are compiled from arrays of bytes into an array of some parameter type P that is constructible from one or more arrays of bytes. Compiled parameter values are referenced by their index in the resulting array. At runtime, the invoke(int) method is called with the parameter index to indicate which P[] to apply to the invocation.
    Author:
    kb

    • Method Detail

      • newParameters

        void newParameters(int parameterCount)
        Create a parameters array with capacity for a specified number of compiled parameter values. The implementation class must call BaseParameterizedEffector.setParameters(Object[]) with the result.
        Parameters:
        parameterCount - The size of the array to create

      • setParameter

        void setParameter(int parameterIndex,
                  byte[][] parameterList)
           throws TargetBindingException
        Compile and set a parameter value from effector arguments specified in gearbox transducers. The parameter value, which may be a scalar or an array, is to be compiled from an array of byte arrays. The implementation class must call BaseParameterizedEffector.setParameter(int, Object) with the result.
        Parameters:
        parameterIndex - The array index in the parameters array P[] to set with the parameter value
        parameterList - An array of parameters, where each parameter is an array of bytes.
        Throws:
        TargetBindingException - On error

      • getParameter

        P getParameter(int parameterIndex)
        Get a compiled parameter value
        Parameters:
        parameterIndex - The parameter index
        Returns:
        The parameter value at the index

      • invoke

        int invoke(int parameterIndex)
    throws EffectorException
        This method is invoked at runtime when triggered by an input transition, passing a parameter index to indicate which parameter object is to be used in the invocation.
        Parameters:
        parameterIndex - This index of the parameter object to be used in the invocation
        Returns:
        User-defined effectors should return 0
        Throws:
        EffectorException - On error
